If the operator or person determines that he has overpaid or paid more than once, which fact has not been determined by the county administrator, he will have three years from date of payment to file a written claim stating the specific ground upon which the claim is founded. The claim shall be audited; and if the claim is approved by the county administrator, the excess amount paid the county may be credited on any amounts then due and payable from the person by whom it was paid, or his administrators or executors. (Ord. of 1-26-1993, § 7) Sec. 78-198. - Administration of article. (a) Authority of county administrator. The county administrator shall administer and enforce the provisions of this article for the levy and collection of the tax imposed by this article. (b) Rules and regulations. The county administrator shall have the power and authority to make and publish reasonable rules and regulations not inconsistent with this article, other ordinances of the county, laws of the state, or the constitution of this state or the United States for the administration and enforcement of the provisions of this article and the collection of the taxes under this article. (c) Records required from operators, form. Every operator renting guest rooms in the unincorporated area of the county shall keep such records, receipts, invoices and other pertinent papers in such form as the county administrator may require. (d) Examination of records, audits. The county administrator or any person authorized in writing by the county administrator may examine the books, papers, records, financial reports, equipment and other facilities of any operator renting guest rooms to a person and any operator liable for the tax in order to verify the accuracy of any return made, or if no return is made by the operator, to ascertain and determine the amount required to be paid. (e) Authority to require reports; contents. In the administration of the provisions of this article, the county administrator may require the filing of reports by any person or class of persons having in their possession or custody information relating to rentals of guest rooms subject to the tax. The reports shall be filed with the county administrator when required by him and shall set forth the rental charged for each occupancy, the dates of occupancy, and such other information as the county administrator may require. (f) Disclosure of business of operators; limitation on rule. The county administrator or any person having an administrative duty under this article shall not make known in any manner the business affairs, operations or information obtained by an audit of books, papers, records, financial reports, equipment and other facilities of any operator or any other person visited or examined in the discharge of official duty, or the amount or source of income, profits, losses, expenditures or any particular set forth or disclosed in any return, or to permit any return or copy or any book containing any abstract or particulars to be seen or examined by any person not having administrative duty under this article, except judicial proceedings or other proceedings necessary to collect the tax levied and assessed by this article. Successors, receivers, trustees, executors, administrators, assignees and guarantors, if directly interested, may be given information as to the items included in the measure and amount of unpaid tax or amounts of tax required to be collected. (Ord. of 1-26-1993, § 8) Sec. 78-199. - Violations. (a) Any person violating any provision of this article shall be tried before the magistrate court of the county. The procedure for enforcement of this article shall be as provided in O.C.G.A. §§ 15-10-60—15-10-66. (b) Upon conviction, a violation of this article may be punished as provided in section 1-13. (c) Any operator or other person who fails to register as required in this article, or to furnish any return required to be made, or who fails or refuses to furnish a supplemental return or other data required by the county administrator or who renders a false or fraudulent return shall be deemed guilty of an offense and upon conviction shall be punished as stated in subsection (b) of this section. Any person required to make, render, sign or verify any report who makes any false or fraudulent report, with intent to defeat or evade the determination of an amount due required by this article to be made, shall be deemed guilty of an offense and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as stated in subsection (b) of this section. (Ord. of 1-26-1993, § 10)

div.head: Chapter 80 - TELECOMMUNICATIONS
div.p:
ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL
Secs. 80-1—80-20. - Reserved. ARTICLE II. - 9-1-1 CHARGE ON PREPAID WIRELESS SERVICE[1]
Footnotes: --- (1) --- Editor's note— Ord. of 7-26-2011, effective Jan. 1, 2012, was not specifically amendatory. Inclusion as §§ 80-21—80-24 was at the editor's discretion.
Sec. 80-21. - Charge imposed. In accordance with O.C.G.A. § 46-5-134.2, there is hereby imposed a prepaid wireless 9-1-1 charge as defined by O.C.G.A. § 46-5-134.2(a)(4) upon every prepaid wireless retail transaction occurring within the jurisdiction of the public service answering point in the amount of 75 cents. (Ord. of 7-26-2011, § 1, eff. 1-1-2012) Sec. 80-22. - Collection of charge. Prepaid wireless 9-1-1 charges collected by sellers shall be remitted to the commissioner of the department of revenue at the times and in the manner provided by O.C.G.A. chapter 8 of title 48 with respect to the sales and use tax imposed on prepaid wireless calling service. (Ord. of 7-26-2011, § 2, eff. 1-1-2012) Sec. 80-23. - Administrative provisions. The clerk of the county is hereby directed to file with the state revenue commissioner a certified copy of the ordinance from which this article was derived and amendments thereto, in accordance with O.C.G.A. § 46-5-134.2(j)(1), within ten days of enactment of the ordinance from which this article was derived. (Ord. of 7-26-2011, § 3, eff. 1-1-2012) Sec. 80-24. - Depositing of funds; use of funds. In accordance with O.C.G.A. § 46-5-134.2(j)(5), funds received by this county from charges imposed by the ordinance from which this article was derived shall be deposited in the emergency telephone system fund maintained by this county pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 46-5-134 and kept separate from general revenue of the jurisdiction; all such funds shall be used exclusively for the purposes authorized by O.C.G.A. § 46-5-134(f). (Ord. of 7-26-2011, § 4, eff. 1-1-2012)
